text:
Firefighters were sent home early from Christchurch fire response, union says HENRY COOKE Last updated 18:25, February 17 2017 1 NEWS 
Secretary Derek Best said many firefighters believe if they had been put into action sooner, more houses would have been saved. 
Experienced firefighters were sent home at a crucial point in the Christchurch fire response, causing the loss of 10 homes, their union says. 
New Zealand Professional Firefighters Union Secretary Derek Best has called for an independent inquiry. 
He said firefighters were sent home for 90 minutes at nightfall on Monday after they had contained but not extinguished the fire. JOHN KIRK-ANDERSON/FAIRFAX NZ 
The Firefighters Union say they could have saved 10 of the 11 homes. 
Just an hour and a half later they called back to the scene, but it was too late.
